activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica J Hughes

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Jessica J Hughes not in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Jessica J Hughes.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates the defendant is in a residential treatment program in Milwaukee.
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Jessica J Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Jessica J Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defense indicates parties are not ready to proceed with a COP today. Makes statements on the record. Seeking time to review discovery with the defendant.
BTC: Matter set over for status.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

9:09 AM Defendant Jessica J Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Jessica J Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense is seeking to modify the bond. Makes statements on the record. Does not have an offer from the State. 
State does not object to defense's request regarding modification of the bond from a cash bond to a signature bond. Does have an offer and puts it on the record. 
BTC: $100 cash bond is modified to $100 signature bond. Matter set over for COP.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:13 PM Defendant Jessica J Hughes not in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski not in court.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter was scheduled as a motion hearing. 
Defense is out sick.
BTC: Matter set over.
